lexUnit.name: past.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person's or thing's history or earlier life.

sentence.text: Or could it be Colebrooke , who had discovered Sir Ralph 's murky past and was promoting his own ambitions under the guise of revenge for past misdeeds ?
Dig deep enough into Cud 's sordid past and you discover many horrible things .
He had a colourful past .
The school 's mathematics syllabus reflects its more ` academic " past , still containing references to logarithms although no one teaches them any more .
But she never let on about her boyfriend 's criminal past .
Their criminal pasts become the ` good old days " , stories for the children .
Let his father see that he truly merited the chiefship , in spite of his wild past !
Another , from our mythical Celtic past was Cú Chulainn , whose heroic deeds are related in the Book of Leinster .
` We have not totally escaped our evolutionary past , " says Dr Wilson .
` At least Mike has n't run away from his past .
New job , new flat , and Max pushed safely , although still painfully , into her London past : the background where he belonged , she thought wryly .
Diana and Mary were curious about my past , but sensitive enough to avoid asking questions which would hurt me .
A dropout with a troubled past of his own , Joey worshipped Seth .
` Angry though he 's made me in the past , he is a good lad .
I would guess that she has been hurt at some time in the past , probably having banged her head or hip .
Also , despite what had occurred in the past between them , SHe needed Cab so badly now it hurt more than the bruises in hir belly .

The Shakespearian phrase echoed down to him from the shadows of his grammar school past .
